document.title: An Overview of the Object Browser Hierarchy

toc.envision_title: An Overview of the Object Browser Hierarchy

paragraph.paragraph: The ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmObject Browser window, like the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer window, contains projects, at the top-level. The number of EiffelEnvision projects in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmObject Browser is directly representative of the number of the same projects contained in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer.
The structure of an EiffelEnvision project in the index.xmlObject Browser adheres to the following hierarchy convention:

Expanding a node that represents an EiffelEnvision project, represented by the ../images/project.ico icon, will always display two child nodes, eiffel_clusters.xmlEiffel Clusters (../images/cluster/hier_cluster_all.ico) and references.xmlReferences (../images/assembly/hier_reference_all.ico). These nodes are a unique additions to the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmObject Browser, as are require due to the way ../../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/adding_references/index.xmlComponent References are dealt with in EiffelEnvision and the ../../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xmlEiffel for .NET language. Note: Expanding an EiffelEnvision project that has not been compiled, or has not compiled information available, will display a the message "System needs to be fully compiled for browsing." EiffelEnvision projects require a project be ../../compiling_projects/index.xmlBuilt before browsing the information contained within the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfObjectBrowserS.htmObject Browser.
